text: An oracle. The word of Yahweh \add is\add* against the land of Hadrach,
and Damascus \add is\add* its resting place.
For to Yahweh belongs the eye of humankind,\f + \fr 9:1 \ft “Eye of humankind” is difficult to understand in this context; some scholars emend the phrase to “cities of Aram” or “capital of Aram” \f*
and all the tribes of Israel,
and also Hamath, \add which\add* borders on it;
Tyre and Sidon—yes, they are very wise!\f + \fr 9:2 \ft That is, wise in their own eyes (ironic) \f*
Tyre has built a fortification for itself,\f + \fr 9:3 \ft Hebrew “her” \f*
and it heaped up silver like dust,
and gold like \add the\add* mud of \add the\add* streets.
Look! The Lord will drive it\f + \fr 9:4 \ft Hebrew “her” \f* out
and will hurl its\f + \fr 9:4 \ft Hebrew “her” \f* outer ramparts into the sea,
and it\f + \fr 9:4 \ft Hebrew “she” \f* will be consumed by fire.
Ashkelon will see and will be afraid,
and Gaza will writhe exceedingly,
and Ekron \add also\add*, because its hope is ruined.\f + \fr 9:5 \ft Traditionally “ashamed”; some presuppose a different Hebrew form and translate “withered” \f*
And the king from Gaza will perish,
and Ashkelon will not be inhabited.
A mongrel people\f + \fr 9:6 \ft That is, a people of mixed marriage; “half-breeds” \f* will dwell in Ashdod,
and I will cut down the pride of \add the\add* Philistines.
I will remove its\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* blood from its\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* mouth,
and its\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* abominations from between its\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* teeth.
And it\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Hebrew “he” \f* too will be a remnant for our God;
and it\f + \fr 9:7 \ft Hebrew “he” \f* will be like a tribal chief\f + \fr 9:7 \ft This word is sometimes interpreted as “clan” \f* in Judah,
and Ekron \add will be\add* like \add the\add* Jebusite.
But I will encamp at my temple\f + \fr 9:8 \ft Or “house” \f* \add like a\add* guard,
against those crossing through and returning;
no oppressor will cross through them again,
for now I have seen with my \add own\add* eyes.
Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion!
Shout aloud, O daughter of Jerusalem!
Look! Your king comes to you;
he \add is\add* righteous and victorious,
humble and riding on a donkey,
and on a male donkey, ⸤the foal of⸥\f + \fr 9:9 \ft Literally “the son of ” \f* a female donkey!
And I will cut off \add the\add* chariot from Ephraim,
and \add the\add* horse from Jerusalem;
the battle bow will be cut down,
and he will announce peace to the nations.
His dominion \add will be\add* from sea to sea,
and from \add the\add* River\f + \fr 9:10 \ft That is, the Euphrates \f* to \add the\add* ends of \add the\add* earth.
\add As for\add* you also, because of the blood of your covenant,
I will release your prisoners from ⸤the waterless pit⸥.\f + \fr 9:11 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft cistern there is not water in him” \f*
Return to \add the\add* fortress,
O prisoners of hope;
today \add I am\add* declaring \add that\add* I will repay you double.
For I have bent Judah \add as\add* my bow;
I have set Ephraim \add as an arrow\add*.
I will set in motion your sons, O Zion,
against your sons, O Javan.\f + \fr 9:13 \ft That is, Greece \f*
I will wield you like the sword of a warrior.
Then Yahweh will appear over them,
and his arrow will go forth like lightning;
and my Lord Yahweh will blow the trumpet,
and he shall go out in the storm winds of \add the\add* south.
Yahweh of hosts will defend them,
and they will devour and subdue the slingstones;\f + \fr 9:15 \ft Perhaps metonymy for the slingers of stones \f*
they will drink, they will make noise\f + \fr 9:15 \ft LXX reads “they will drink blood like wine” \f* like wine,
and they will be full like the sacrificial basin,\f + \fr 9:15 \ft That is, the ceremonial bowl used by the priest for sprinkling blood \f*
\add drenched\add* like the corners of an altar.
And Yahweh their God will save them on that day,
as the flock of his people;
for \add they are like\add* the stones of a diadem,
glittering on his land.
For how \add great is\add* his goodness, and how \add great is\add* his beauty!
Grain will make the young men thrive,
and new wine \add the\add* young women.
